title: Smith & Nephew boss departs in wake of pay row
text:
The boss of Smith & Nephew is stepping down after just 18 months in the role amid reports the medical equipment manufacturer could not meet his pay demands, sending shares into a tailspin.

Namal Nawana will step down as chief executive “by mutual agreement on 31 October 2019 to pursue other opportunities outside of the UK”, the FTSE 100 company said.

Shares sank 7pc to £17.02 in morning trading in London.

It was reported in June that Smith & Nephew, which can trace its roots back to 1896 at a pharmacy in Hull, was exploring switching its listing to the US, where there are fewer restrictions on executive pay.
